thread.title: Peace protesters celebrate after court victory over arms industry conference arrests
thread.title_full: Peace protesters celebrate after court victory over arms industry conference arrests

author: JOHN WEEKES
title: Peace protesters celebrate after court victory over arms industry conference arrests
text:
Peace protesters celebrate after court victory over arms industry conference arrests JOHN WEEKES Last updated 11:58, February 23 2017 FAIRFAX NZ 
Members of Peace Action Wellington celebrate after charges stemming from a protest at an arms industry conference were dropped. 
Peace activists arrested at an arms industry conference say they're happy after charges against them were dropped. 
The members of Peace Action Wellington voiced displeasure at police for the arrests, and the court process which has continued since the late 2015 arms industry conference. 
"It's been really stressful and draining," Emma Cullen said outside Wellington District Court on Thursday. "It's been 15 months we've been waiting." KEVIN STENT/FAIRFAX NZ 
A Peace Action Wellington protester arrested outside the TSB Arena. 
The group faced a range of charges, mostly for trespassing. 
About 150 protesters gathered outside the New Zealand Defence Industry Association annual forum at the TSB Arena in November 2015. 
Wellington City councillor Iona Pannett joined the protesters. 
On Thursday, the group said they would do the same thing again. 
"The real people that were the criminals on the day were the people in the building, trying to sell weapons and make money to profit from war. So we're not going to stop," Cullen said. 
The group said all the police charges fell over, either for lack of evidence, or because the group weren't actually trespassing. 
"[It was] public land, which we knew at the time," one said. 
Police have been approached for comment. - Stuff
